column4: k so the good news is... im still on ubuntu! XD the bad news is that i had to go and blacklist again :P
make an entry in /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist
where do i find that sorry ?
nvm found it
/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf it's a file
oh good
just had trouble finding etc :P so how do i edit it? it opens as read only, gonna keep looking but if you answer before i find.. yea XD
yea cant find how to edit it ><
gksudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf
yes
That opens a text editor (gedit) as root gksudo
probably just garabage from gedit
but it was saved.. so should i just try to reboot?
did gedit open with the file in it?
yeah, what did you add to the file?
^ forgot space lol, not sure if that changes things
that's good
awesome, alright ill reboot and well see what happens?
just wanna make sure theres not other step
reboot :)
alrighty brb :)
